titulo: A Day in the Life of a Space Explorer
texto: Captain Sarah is an astronaut on the International Space Station. She wakes up at 6:00 AM every day. For breakfast, she eats special space food from a bag. During the day, she does experiments and fixes things on the station. She exercises for two hours because gravity is very weak in space. In the evening, she looks out the window at Earth. She thinks our planet is beautiful and very blue.

preguntas.pregunta: Where does Captain Sarah live?
What time does she wake up?
Why does she exercise for two hours?
opciones: Because gravity is weak in space

preguntas.pregunta: What does she do in the evening?
opciones: She looks at Earth through the window

preguntas.pregunta: What does she think about Earth?
opciones: It is very big and green

texto: The Great Barrier Reef is the largest coral reef system in the world. It is located in Australia. Thousands of different animals live there, including colorful fish, sea turtles, and sharks. Scientists visit the reef to study the corals and the animals. Unfortunately, the ocean is getting warmer, and this is dangerous for the reef. We must protect the ocean to keep the fish and the corals healthy.

preguntas.pregunta: Where is the Great Barrier Reef?
What animals can you find there?
What is the problem for the reef?
Who visits the reef to study it?
Why must we protect the ocean?
opciones: To keep the reef and animals healthy

texto: Arthur was a legendary king of Britain. Many years ago, there was a magical sword in a big stone. The people said that only the true king could pull it out. Many strong men tried, but they failed. One day, young Arthur pulled the sword out very easily. He became the King of Britain and lived in a beautiful castle called Camelot with his Brave Knights of the Round Table.

preguntas.pregunta: Who was Arthur?
Where was the magical sword?
Who could pull the sword out of the stone?
What was the name of Arthur's castle?
Who lived with King Arthur in the castle?
opciones: The Knights of the Round Table

texto: Last month, my class went on a school trip to London. We travelled by plane from Valencia. It was my first time on a plane! In London, we saw many famous places. We visited the British Museum and saw old mummies from Egypt. We also saw Big Ben, the famous clock tower. It was raining a little, but we had umbrellas. My favorite part was the London Eye because the view was amazing.

texto: If you want to be healthy and strong, you must follow some simple rules. First, you should eat fruit and vegetables every day. They have vitamins. Second, you should drink a lot of water and not too much soda. Third, sleep is very important. Children need about ten hours of sleep every night. Finally, you should do exercise. You can play football, swim, or just walk in the park. Healthy habits make you feel happy!

What should you drink?

How do healthy habits make you feel?

texto: The Romans were people from a city called Rome, in Italy. They built a very large empire many centuries ago. Romans were good at building roads, bridges, and aqueducts. They spoke Latin. Many languages today, like Spanish and French, come from Latin. Romans liked watching games in big stadiums called amphitheaters. The most famous one is the Colosseum in Rome.

texto: Rainforests are very special forests where it rains almost every day. They are home to more than half of the world's plants and animals. The weather is always hot and humid. Huge trees grow in the rainforest, and their leaves form a 'canopy' like a green roof. Animals like monkeys, toucans, and jaguars live there. Rainforests are important because they produce a lot of oxygen for the Earth.

What is the weather like there?
Which animal lives in the rainforest?
What do we call the 'green roof' of the trees?
Why are rainforests important for the Earth?

texto: Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone in 1876. Before the telephone, people wrote letters to communicate. The first words Bell said on the phone were to his assistant: 'Mr. Watson, come here, I want to see you.' Today, we have mobile phones that are like small computers. We can speak to people, take photos, and play games. Communication is very different now!

When was the telephone invented?
Who was Mr. Watson?
How did people communicate before the phone?
What can we do with modern mobile phones?
opciones: Only use them as a clock

texto: Plants start their life as a small seed. When a seed has water and light, it starts to grow. This is called germination. First, the roots grow down into the soil. Then, a small stem grows up towards the sun. Leaves grow on the stem to catch sunlight for energy. Finally, the plant produces flowers and new seeds. This is the life cycle of a plant.

What do seeds need to grow?
What is 'germination'?
opciones: When a seed starts to grow

Why do plants need leaves?
